page.title: 04TREE CONSERVATION IN L'BORO
page.content: The Outwoods is a popular area of recreation just a few miles from Loughborough town centre. It is a mixed wood with much plant and animal life, including a nature trail, foot paths and bridle paths. During the past year there has been a large conservation programme. Seven acres of land have been planted with young trees. Many of the local groups have helped plant the trees. The local cub pack planted trees on May 2,l985. On Thursday 27 June Loughborough had a Royal visit from Princess Diana and Prince Charles. Prince Charles had been invited as Patron of The Men of the Trees to plant the 10,000th tree. It was an exciting day: six people from our school were invited. Prince Charles planted an oak tree. We hope the new plantation will provide much pleasure in the future.
